attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Traditionally used for pain relief in labour, this gaseous analgesia would be most helpful when changing surgical dressings - it's much more fast acting than oral medication and gives back a sense of control to the patient during operative measures 

On the subject of wond care, please can the PM offer guidance also to Trusts on : 

a) pre - dressing analgesia procedure (to give pain killers before any intervention is basic common sense but there are lapses !), 

b) privacy and confidentiality (junior staff are being told not to draw curtains because THE CONSULTANT doesn't like it ... the curtains are put there for the PATIENTS !!). 

c) documentation - what about pre printed labels as a checklist of wound care procedures and stat medication (known as PRN) on the drugs sheets to save junior drs' time ?
